p.s: Description of Saccharomonospora cyanea sp. nov.
Saccharomonospora cyanea (cy.an'e.a. N.L. adj. cyanea, dark blue, referring to the color of the aerial mycelium)
Single spores borne mainly on aerial mycelium.
Spores oval to ellipsoidal, 0.8 to 1.0 by 1.0 to 1.8 Î¼m.

The color of the aerial mycelium is light blue to dark blue on oatmeal agar, glycerol-asparagine agar, inorganic salts-starch agar, tyrosine agar, nutrient agar, calcium malate agar, potato extract agar, and Czapek sucrose agar.
No distinct soluble pigment is formed.
Utilizes D-fructose, mannose, L-rhamnose, ribose, D-xylose, sucrose, maltose, lactose, trehalose, glycerol, and raffinose, but not L-arabinose, i-inositol, D-mannitol, melibiose, or D-glucose.
No antibiotic activity was found by using the agar block method and Staphylococcus aureus, Escherichia coli, and Bacillus subtilis as test organisms.
The type strain is strain NA-134 (= SIIA 86134 = ATCC 43724).
